column4: thanks, but i have basic questions, like "can I do a peer to peer network?"  I was told that if all I want to do is share files then, changing a directories properties to sharing will allow that.  is that true?
should be. that's just a way to activate samba
sorry are you saying that if I turn on the sharing i will be activating samba?  or are you saying I can peer to peer with samba?
the former
The manuals you sent me are for setting up servers and domains etc.   I don't need or want all that.
fair enough

yikes... errors.  What does this mean? The following packages have unmet dependencies:   samba4: Depends: samba4-common (= 4.0.0~alpha6-1ubuntu1) but it is not going to be installed   E: Broken packages
what version of ubuntu are you using ?
i have the last version
which is? do "lsb_release -a" in a terminal
last version is 9.10. and in 9.04 and 9.10 the sharing options do not need samba4 they need samba3...
so I should do the same command you gave me, but just change it to samba3 instead of 4?
E: Couldn't find package samba3
no; something is wrong in your system. are you sure is 9.04 and not 10.04 ??
I am sure it is 9.04
you should install samba not samba4
sudo aptitude install samba
what error you get ?
it may not have worked because I opend synaptic when the samba4 did not work... will try after down load.
Can you set up a network, peer to peer, using live cd?
